description: Demolition of existing garage, erection of single storey side and rear extension with new porch
decision_conditions: The roof of the extension hereby permitted shall not be converted or used as a balcony or a sitting out area, and no access shall be gained except for maintenance purposes.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Details of the facing materials to be utilised in the development hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works on site are commenced. The development shall then be built in accordance with these approved details.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012. These details are required prior to commencement of development because the details would affect subsequent design of other elements of the scheme and must be agreed at the outset.

Consultations6no. surrounding properties were notified of the proposed development. No representations received.ProposalThe application seeks planning permission for the demolition of garage and conservatory and partial demolition of ground floor, and erection of two-storey side, single storey front, and part single/part double storey rear extensionPlanning History22/03607/PAEXT - Erection of 2no single-storey ground floor, flat roof, rear extensions (8.00m in depth, maximum height of 3.00m and eaves height of 2.85m) following partial demolition of existing rear kitchen and full demolition of existing conservatory. Prior Approval Not Required, dated 28.12.2022.23/00672/HOU - Erection of single storey rear outbuilding. Granted planning permission, dated 17.04.2023.Planning AssessmentThe key considerations in the assessment of this application are:-	Character and Appearance; -	The Impact upon Residential Amenity; and-	Fire SafetyCharacter and AppearancePolicy D3 of the London Plan 2021 states that development proposals should enhance local context by delivering buildings and spaces that positively respond to local distinctiveness through their layout, orientation, scale, appearance and shape, with due regard to existing and emerging street hierarchy, building types, forms and proportions.When read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area.This application seeks permission for a part single part double-storey side extension and a first floor rear extension. On the ground floor, the house is proposed to be extended by approximately 3.3m in width (following the demolition of the existing detached garage to accommodate an enlarged open plan kitchen/dining room, a wet room and replacement garage space. Officers note an 8m rear extension was previously approved under a prior approval application. The first floor is proposed to be extended by 4m in depth and 3.6m in width to create larger bedroom. A further first floor side extension over the garage would accommodate a study with an en-suite and measure approximately 3.3m in width and 11m in depth.The extensions are considered to appear proportionate additions to the application property, with matching materials. Given the above, it is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.Impact upon Residential AmenityPolicy D3 of the London Plan 2021 requires new development to deliver appropriate outlook, privacy and amenity. Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) is clear that development proposals should have regard to the amenities of occupants and neighbours, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officers note an 8m rear extension was previously approved under a prior approval application. The depth of the rear extension hereby submitted does not go beyond that approved under the prior approval permission.The proposed first floor extension would not encroach upon the 45-degree line to either neighbouring property. No side facing windows are proposed at first floor level. As such the proposals would not result in loss of privacy to either neighbouring property. It is not considered that the proposed additions would result in any harmful overlooking impacts onto neighbouring sites and it is not thought to appear overly dominant or result in loss of light or outlook. It is therefore considered that the proposed development by virtue of its scale and design would not cause any significant harm to the outlook, privacy or daylight/sunlight provision of neighbouring occupiers and would comply with Policy DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012. Fire SafetyLondon Plan Policy D12(A) requires all development proposals to achieve the highest standards of fire safety, embedding these at the earliest possible stage.The applicant has not submitted a Fire Safety Strategy, however, the plans include the provision of a suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point and officers see no reason why a development of the type sought could not comply with the rest of the provisions of Policy D12(A), the details of which could be secured through conditions. For these reasons, officers conclude that the proposal would not conflict with Policy D12 of the London Plan.ConclusionIn conclusion, the proposed development would accord with the relevant policies of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), and Policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Core Strategy (2012).The proposal by virtue of its scale, design and materiality is considered to be proportionate to the host dwelling and would not result in harm to the character and appearance of the host dwelling or wider area. In addition, the proposals would not result in materially harmful impact to neighbouring amenity by way of overlooking, loss of light or sense of overbearing or enclosure. Recommendation:That planning permission be GRANTED.

I acknowledge receipt of your payment for £174. As you are proposing a self contained residential dwelling the fee required for this application is £1,500, therefore please forward the outstanding balance of £1,326 as soon as possible.Note: Payment can be made online via the Kingston council website, via our Contact Centre on 020 8547 5002, or by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames
